The First Axiom TEA
0 0 Data Data
1 Precursor 3 (Before you shuffle your deck to start the game, you may reveal up to 12 total precursor value of cards with different names from your deck. Anomaly -2 TEA
!token !related Turn Structure Part 2
1 Until your next untap step, the first two times you would get +{B}, you don’t get that {B} instead. 1 Turn Structure Part 2
Anomaly -1 TEA
!token !related Turn Structure Part 2
1 Until your next untap step, the first time you would get +{B}, you don’t get that {B} instead. 1 Turn Structure Part 2
Anomaly +1 TEA
!token !related Turn Structure Part 2
1 +{B}. 1 Turn Structure Part 2
Anomaly +2 TEA
!token !related Turn Structure Part 2
1 +BB. 1 Turn Structure Part 2
Turn Structure Part 1 TEA
!token
1 >Stockpile Phase: You may pay any amount of Bits. Gain that many draw points. >Untap Phase: Untap each permanent you control. (Anomalies aren’t permanents.) >Draw Phase: You gain 2 draw points. Then you may spend any amount of draw points, as follows: >2 draw points: Draw a card. >3 draw points: Set aside cards from the top of your deck face up until you set aside a Data card. Put the Data card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck in a random order. 1
Turn Structure Part 2 TEA
!token !related Turn Structure Part 1
1 >Anomaly Phase: Choose one of your untapped anomalies. Tap it and gain its effect this turn. Then if all of your anomalies are tapped, untap them. >Combat Phase: You may attack with any number of untapped creatures you control by tapping them. Then, your opponent may assign any number of untapped creatures they control as blockers blocking attackers you control. Then, they fight, dealing damage with strength (The first creature stat). >Main Phase: You may play cards with normal speed. >Discard Phase: Discard down to cards in hand equal to your max hand size, which defaults to 8. >End Phase: Each player loses all bits. (They do not lose draw points.) 1 Turn Structure Part 1
